The '''Chasm of Ilmen''' ([[Qenya]]: ''Ilmen-assa'')<ref>{{SM|5c}}, Note #5</ref> is the gap between the edge of [[Ambar|the World]] and [[Vaiya]]. It is filled with the air of [[Ilmen]].<ref name=fashion>{{SM|5b}}</ref>

Where the interior seas fell down the Chasm of Ilmen, their waterfalls made bridges of ice which close the chasm. The ice extended to all [[Vaiya]] and even the [[Ilurambar]].<ref name=fashion/>

[[Tilion]] who guides the [[Moon]] plunges in the chasm between the western shores of the earth and Vaiya, the Outer Sea.<ref name=fashion/><ref name="LRQ">{{LR|Quenta}}, p.242</ref>
==Other versions of the legendarium==
[[Christopher Tolkien]] notes that in the [[Ambarkanta]], as well as an earlier unfinished version of the Silmarillion (c. 1937),<ref name="LRQ"/> there is a chasm ''between'' the Earth and the Outer Sea (=Vaiya), into which Tilion guides the Moon. However for the published [[Silmarillion]],<ref>Cf. {{S|11}}</ref> he preferred a later passage (c. 1951)<ref>Cf. {{AA|177}}</ref> where [[Tilion]] plunges into an unnamed chasm which is ''beyond'' the Outer Sea (=[[Ekkaia]]).<ref>{{SM|5e}}, p.154, footnote</ref> In a later note, Christopher accepts that although his father wrote that, it is not what he intended, and the Chasm lies before the Outer Sea, rather than beyond it.<ref>{{MR|P2r}}, §177, pp. 136-7</ref>
